name: Scottish Oatcakes
author: Chef John
summary: The perfect breakfast solution for people who cannot decide between oatmeal and pancakes, this recipe is for the softer pancake version of the popular dry, dense, and cookie-like oat cakes. Serve with fresh fruit and top with butter and maple syrup.
directions: Bring oats and heavy cream to a simmer in a pot over medium-high heat
Stir and cook for 1 minute and turn off the heat
Let cool down to room temperature, at least 10 minutes
Transfer oat mixture into a bowl
Add lemon zest and lemon juice
Drizzle in honey and crack in an egg
Stir in flour until no dry spots remain
Cover and let rest for at least 1 hour
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat
Scoop spoonfuls of the oat mixture into the hot skillet and flatten to your desired thickness
Cook until browned and tops spring back when touched, 3 to 4 minutes per side
